page.title: 10HILL FARM, CHILDERDITCH.
page.content:
Hill Farm has been a farm since the Middle Ages. The present owners are Mr. and Mrs. Bloomfield. The Bloomfield family have worked the farm for three generations,and the present size of the farm is 205 acres. Most of the land is owned by the Bloomfield family but part is owned by the Church and part by the Council.
Hill Farm has always been a Dairy Farm. At the time of our visit in June 1985 there were 80 Friesian cows and a Polled Hereford bull named Senator. Due to E.E.C. milk quotas Hill Farm is now in the process of changing to a completely Arable farm. The present crops grown are :- Winter Barley and Cultivated Pasture. Permanant Pasture 63 acres.
